means: 废除主义者，废奴主义者
废除主义者的，主张废除主义的

sentence.Network_en: He began his own abolitionist newspaper, The North Star.
sentence.Network_cn: 他自己创办了主张废除奴隶制的报纸《北方之星》.

sentence.Network_en: As long as most people are happy to have the monarchy, the abolitionist position is an arrogant fantasy.
sentence.Network_cn: 只要大多数人还乐意保留君主制，废除它的主张就是痴人说梦。

sentence.Network_en: The abolitionist dedicated their whole life to this great revolution.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些废奴主义者为这伟大的革命奉献了他们的一生.

entry.tran: 废除主义者;主张废除（某种制度或习俗）的人
entry.def: An abolitionist is someone who campaigns for the abolition of a particular system or practice.

example.ex: By 1838, the abolitionists had shamed parliament into ending slavery in British colonies...
example.tran: 到1838年，废奴主义者迫使议会出于道德压力而废除了英国殖民地的奴隶制。

example.ex: As long as most people are happy to have the monarchy, the abolitionist position is an arrogant fantasy.
example.tran: 只要大多数人还乐意保留君主制，废除它的主张就是痴人说梦。

means.word_mean: 1. a reformer who favors abolishing slavery

auth_sentence.content: The same could be said of the abolitionist or civil-rights movements.
auth_sentence.res_content: The same could be said of the abolitionist or civil-rights movements.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The same could be said of the abolitionist or civil-rights movements.

auth_sentence.content: The most prescient was Frederick Douglass, the vibrant ex-slave turned abolitionist orator.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The most prescient was Frederick Douglass, the vibrant ex-slave turned abolitionist orator.

auth_sentence.content: The Committee helped to persuade the member of parliament William Wilberforce to take up the abolitionist cause.
